column4: hi! how can i start a custom command at boot up? (before gdm)
i used to use "noacpi" kernel option but it still freezes i think...
there were a case when it freezed why noacpi
so now i restart with noacpi and see if it works ok?
another thing to test is to NOT start X, make the notebook work heavily so cooling is active and check if it happens then
if it still happens, all your X programs are off the hook
have you tried with nv yet?
nv never works for me, as i said
i tried it and no help
i've just tried in a couple of hours ago. blank screen
can you suggest me some applications what are killing cpu for sure? i mean i want to overload my system to see if it breaks or nnot
i checked my ubuntu, no noacpi and anything helped. i didn't check yet what if i don't start X
it's freezing with or without noacpi
